Groups.Group: Internet Security Benchmarks + Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Level 1

Advanced.DetectScript:
#!/bin/bash RV=0 REASON="Password Reuse is not Limited." EXPECT="Limit Password Reuse."
options=$(egrep "^[^#]|^password[[:space:]]*sufficient[[:space:]]*pam_unix.so[[:space:]]*" /etc/pam.d/system-auth |egrep "remember[[:space:]]*=[[:space:]]*5[[:space:]]*" ) if [ -z "$options" ]; then RV=1 fi if [ $RV -eq 1 ]; then echo $REASON >&1 echo $EXPECT >&2 fi exit $RV

Vulnerability.Title: Limit Password Reuse
Vulnerability.Description: The /etc/security/opasswd file stores the users' old passwords and can be checked to ensure that users are not recycling recent passwords. Note: This content will only provide detection of the security threat or vulnerability. Remediation must be performed manually.
